publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1970# Miss Annabel Goldie: Endometriosis—That the Parliament notes the debilitating effect which endometriosis has upon many women in Scotland; acknowledges the need for greater awareness of this disease amongst the general public and the medical profession, and encourages greater co-operation between relevant organisations and individuals to facilitate the early diagnosis and treatment of the disorder.
S1M-1970# Endometriosis (lodged on 29 May 2001) Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Mr David Davidson*

S1M-1970# Miss Annabel Goldie: Endometriosis—That the Parliament notes the debilitating effect which endometriosis has upon many women in Scotland; acknowledges the need for greater awareness of this disease amongst the general public and the medical profession, and encourages greater co-operation between relevant organisations and individuals to facilitate the early diagnosis and treatment of the disorder. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson, Mr David Davidson
S1M-1970# Endometriosis (lodged on 29 May 2001) Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-1970# Endometriosis (lodged on 29 May 2001) Alex Neil*, David Mundell*, Mr Jamie McGrigor*, Tricia Marwick*

S1M-1970# Endometriosis (lodged on 29 May 2001) Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Nora Radcliffe*, Mr Keith Harding*, Mr Brian Monteith*, Hugh Henry*, Bill Aitken*, Ms Sandra White*

S1M-1970# Miss Annabel Goldie: Endometriosis—That the Parliament notes the debilitating effect which endometriosis has upon many women in Scotland; acknowledges the need for greater awareness of this disease amongst the general public and the medical profession, and encourages greater co-operation between relevant organisations and individuals to facilitate the early diagnosis and treatment of the disorder. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson, Mr David Davidson, Tommy Sheridan, Alex Neil, David Mundell, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Tricia Marwick, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Keith Harding, Mr Brian Monteith, Hugh Henry, Bill Aitken, Ms Sandra White
S1M-1970# Endometriosis (lodged on 29 May 2001) Linda Fabiani*
S1M-1970# Endometriosis (lodged on 29 May 2001) Christine Grahame*, Scott Barrie*
S1M-1970# Endometriosis (lodged on 29 May 2001) Dr Elaine Murray*

S1M-1970# Miss Annabel Goldie: Endometriosis—That the Parliament notes the debilitating effect which endometriosis has upon many women in Scotland; acknowledges the need for greater awareness of this disease amongst the general public and the medical profession, and encourages greater co-operation between relevant organisations and individuals to facilitate the early diagnosis and treatment of the disorder. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson, Mr David Davidson, Tommy Sheridan, Alex Neil, David Mundell, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Tricia Marwick, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Keith Harding, Mr Brian Monteith, Hugh Henry, Bill Aitken, Ms Sandra White, Linda Fabiani, Christine Grahame, Scott Barrie, Dr Elaine Murray, Nick Johnston*
S1M-1970# Endometriosis (lodged on 29 May 2001) Mr John McAllion*, Fergus Ewing*, Michael Russell*
S1M-1970# Endometriosis (lodged on 29 May 2001) Elaine Smith*
S1M-1970# Endometriosis (lodged on 29 May 2001) Margaret Jamieson*

S1M-1970# Miss Annabel Goldie: Endometriosis—That the Parliament notes the debilitating effect which endometriosis has upon many women in Scotland; acknowledges the need for greater awareness of this disease amongst the general public and the medical profession, and encourages greater co-operation between relevant organisations and individuals to facilitate the early diagnosis and treatment of the disorder. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson, Mr David Davidson, Tommy Sheridan, Alex Neil, David Mundell, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Tricia Marwick, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Keith Harding, Mr Brian Monteith, Hugh Henry, Bill Aitken, Ms Sandra White, Linda Fabiani, Christine Grahame, Scott Barrie, Dr Elaine Murray, Nick Johnston, Mr John McAllion, Fergus Ewing, Michael Russell, Elaine Smith, Margaret Jamieson
